solution_line_template: John starts with {initial_rope_length}ft of rope that he cuts in half, meaning he has {initial_rope_length}/{first_cut_divisor}= <<{initial_rope_length}/{first_cut_divisor}={first_half_length}>>{first_half_length}-foot sections of rope.

He then takes one of these sections and cuts it in half again, leaving him with two {first_half_length}/{second_cut_divisor}= <<{first_half_length}/{second_cut_divisor}={second_half_length}>>{second_half_length}-foot sections of rope.

He then takes one of these sections and cuts it into fifths, leaving him with {second_half_length}/{third_cut_divisor}= <<{second_half_length}/{third_cut_divisor}={final_piece_length}>>{final_piece_length} foot sections of rope, one of which he is now holding.
